name: Heart of the Dungeon
description:
This isometric hack-and-slash adventure game features a cast of delightfully weird monsters with full voice acting. Gobkin, a small cat-like Goblin who was cast out from his tribe for being too cute and friendly, finds himself in a dungeon with other rejected monsters. Osseus, the noble skeleton who is missing most of their bones, and Rotta, a fierce but adorably fluffy dungeon rat, will follow Gobkin as they attempt to unite the denizens of this outcast dungeon to fight off a troupe of “heroic” adventurers. 

Counter the dungeon invaders with the aid of your companions and convince your would-be allies to join you. Though it won’t be easy; You may need to deal with threats from within before can face those from outside…

CONTROLS:
  • WASD for movement
  • E to interact
  • Left click to attack
HEART 20 GAMES IS:
  •  Ianoc- Programming
  • Jeremiah Johnson - Music, narrative, production
  • Kumusta - UI + graphics
  • Shell, Shelldragon, Juett -Character art, animation, video editing, narrative assistance, production
  • John Stevenson - Writing, narrative
  • Tora- Environment art
  • Matt Wood - Sound design, scripting
  • Zach, Professor Cowboy - Programming, production
MORAL SUPPORT PROVIDED BY: 

Gabe Cazares, Jeff Ingraham, Rachel Moe, and Ray Pencil.

Studio pets: Freddie Meowcury the cat, Raven the cat, Kimiko the bun

ADDITIONAL TRAILER AND ANIMATION SUPPORT PROVIDED BY:

Ray Pencil

VOICE ACTING PROVIDED BY:
  • Leila Blue Aram-Panahi as Rotta, Rogue Adventurer, and Demons 
  • BJ Becker as Baelor Beneficent, King Verpfeifen, and Claviculus Clepta
  • Douglas the Beerbarian as The "Hero", Sir Slimeington, Demon Prince, Rat Guards, and Skeletal Guards
  • Taze Campbell as Noob Adventurer, Skeletal Guards, and Demons
  • Jeremiah Johnson as Skeletal Guards and Trailer Narrator
  • Jessica Robins as Gobkin, Osteon, and Rat Guards
  • Kyle Robinson as Osseus, Demons, and Rat Guards
  • Amanda Warhammer as Venel and Rat Guards
THE JAM:

This game was developed for the Seattle Indies Slow Jam 2022, over two weeks. All visual assets, voice acting, and music were created in-house for this jam. Sound effects partly sourced from SFX libraries and partly created and edited in-house. Developed using Unity, Yarn Spinner, Photoshop, Reaper, and FMOD.

CONTENT DISCLAIMER:

Cartoon violence, themes of death, grief, and family conflict.
